ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Central Auditory Processing Disorder (secondary to right internal capsule infarction)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Normal peripheral hearing sensitivity but deficits on central tests (SSW, Dichotic Digits, Frequency Patterns) consistent with the confirmed right basal ganglia/internal capsule lesion.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To evaluate the cause of acute vertigo, twitching, and slurred speech (performed prior to audiology).
To assess peripheral hearing sensitivity as part of the research evaluation.
To assess word recognition ability in quiet.
To evaluate central auditory processing function given the known brain lesion.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient demonstrates normal peripheral hearing sensitivity and excellent speech recognition in quiet. However, central auditory testing reveals deficits consistent with the right internal capsule lesion. Specifically, there is a 'contralateral effect' with left ear deficits on dichotic tasks (SSW, Dichotic Digits) and bilateral abnormalities on Frequency Patterns.

tests.name: Radiology (CT Scan)
tests.result_summary: Small discrete lesion at the right internal capsule, possibly involving the globus pallidus, consistent with infarction.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Normal hearing sensitivity bilaterally. Thresholds 0-15 dB HL from 250-4000 Hz, with a slight dip to 15-20 dB HL at 8000 Hz.

tests.name: Central Auditory Tests
tests.result_summary: Staggered Spondaic Words (SSW) abnormal for the left ear (~80%). Dichotic Digits showed bilateral deficits with the left ear more pronounced (LE ~70%, RE ~85%). Frequency Patterns were bilaterally abnormal (RE ~40%, LE ~65%).

proposed_items: Monitor for any changes in auditory processing over time.
counseling_actions: Inform the patient that while hearing sensitivity is normal, the brain's ability to process complex signals is affected by the stroke.
Explain the concept of contralateral deficits (right brain lesion affecting left ear processing).
Advise that subtle difficulties may occur in challenging listening environments like background noise or rapid speech.

escalation.rationale_short: The patient is already under neurological care; audiological findings are for monitoring and research purposes.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor recovery and any subjective changes in auditory processing.

expected_outcome: The patient is essentially doing well.
She retains right temporal pain and occasional right arm aches and leg cramping.
She has not experienced a recurrence of dizziness.
